IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE SPECIFICALLY FOCUS ON HELPING BOYS REACH THEIR POTENTIAL THROUGH PERSONALIZED, STRUCTURED, INNOVATIVE LEARNING PRACTICES IN A COLLEGE PREPARATORY, ALL-BOARDING COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE SPECIFICALLY FOCUS ON HELPING BOYS REACH THEIR POTENTIAL THROUGH PERSONALIZED, STRUCTURED, INNOVATIVE LEARNING PRACTICES IN A COLLEGE PREPARATORY, ALL-BOARDING COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION AND SCHOLARSHIP - SECONDARY LEVEL EDUCATION WAS PROVIDED TO APPROXIMATELY 200 ENROLLED STUDENTS. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND SCHOLARSHIPS WERE GRANTED TO 54 OF THE TOTAL STUDENTS ENROLLED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FOOD SERVICES, STUDENT LODGING AND FACILITIES - THE SCHOOL PROVIDED THESE SERVICES TO APPROXIMATELY 200 STUDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: STUDENT ACTIVITIES AND SERVICES - FIELD TRIPS, SPECIAL ACTIVITIES, STUDENT PUBLICATIONS, ATHLETICS, DANCES AND MOVIES WERE PROVIDED FOR APPROXIMATELY 200 STUDENTS.

OtherRevenueMiscGrp.Desc: INCREASE IN CSV OF LIFE INSURANCE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO SUPPORT FINANCIAL AID, SCHOOL PROGRAMS, AND OPERATIONAL NEEDS.

THE SCHOOL HAS REVIEWED AND EVALUATED THE RELEVANT TECHNICAL MERITS OF EACH OF ITS TAX POSITIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDANCE ESTABLISHED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD AND DETERMINED THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATMENTS OF THE SCHOOL.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED AGAINST INCOME ON 990 22,655. VALUATION CHANGES -11,707.

FINANCIAL AID/SCHOLARSHIPS NETTED AGAINST TUITION ON FINANCIAL STATMENTS 1,939,471. OTHER EXPENSES NETTED AGAINST INCOME ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 173,805. OTHER INCOME NETTED AGAINST EXPENSES ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 550.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED AGAINST INCOME ON 990 22,655.

FINANCIAL AID/SCHOLARSHIPS NETTED AGAINST TUITION ON FINANCIAL STATMENTS 1,939,471. OTHER EXPENSES NETTED AGAINST INCOME ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 173,805. OTHER INCOME NETTED AGAINST EXPENSES ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 550.

A STATEMENT OF THE NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY OF THE SCHOOL IS PRINTED ON ALL CATALOGUES, APPLICATIONS, NOTIFICATIONS, AND OTHER SIGNIFICANT PUBLICATIONS OF THE SCHOOL. BLUE RIDGE SCHOOL, INC. USES PRINTED ADVERTISING MATERIAL IN RECRUITING STUDENTS THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES AND ITS TERRITORIES. IN ORDER TO ASSIST IN RECRUITING A STUDENT BODY REFLECTING A BROAD SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC MIX, ALL SUCH MATERIALS CONTAIN AN UNEQUIVOCAL STATEMENT OF THE SCHOOL'S NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICIES AS APPLIED TO ALL FACETS OF SCHOOL LIFE. SPECIAL EMPHASIS IS MADE ON THESE POLICIES IN THE AREA OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: NON-CASH FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF REDUCED TUITION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL PROVIDES NON-CASH FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF REDUCED TUITION.
THE HEADMASTER, WILLIAM DARRIN, IS PROVIDED WITH A RESIDENCE LOCATED ON THE CAMPUS OF THE SCHOOL. THIS IS NOT TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION, PURSUANT TO I.R.C. SEC. 119(A)(2).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, HEAD OF SCHOOL, AND BUSINESS OFFICER REVIEW A DRAFT COPY OF FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING. ANY QUESTIONS OR CHANGES ARE RESOLVED PRIOR TO FILING. EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES RECEIVES A COPY OF THE FINAL VERSION OF FORM 990 PRIOR TO THE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL REQUIRES EACH OFFICER AND BOARD TRUSTEE TO ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT AFFIRMING THAT SUCH PERSON HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY, AND UNDERSTANDS THAT THE SCHOOL IS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION AND THAT IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION, IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. THE BUSINESS OFFICER AND HEADMASTER MONITOR AND ENFORCE THIS POLICY BY HOLDING ALL BUSINESS AND GOVERNANCE TRANSACTIONS UP FOR SCRUTINY AGAINST THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS ASSIGNED THE RESPONSIBILITY OF DETERMINING AND APPROVING THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S CONTRACTUAL COMPENSATION AMOUNT. THE SCHOOL DETERMINES A COMPETITIVE SALARY BY ANALYZING COMPARABLE MARKET DATA PROVIDED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, EXAMINING COMPENSATION AMOUNTS REPORTED ON FORMS 990 OF SIMILAR SCHOOLS, AND BY UTILIZING OTHER ONLINE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION SURVEYS. THE APPROVED COMPENSATION AMOUNTS ARE DOCUMENTED IN A CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENT, WHICH GENERALLY SPANS MULTIPLE YEARS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REEVALUATES THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S COMPENSATION AMOUNTS FOR EVERY NEW CONTRACTUAL ARRANGEMENT WITH THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B: THE COMPENSATION OF THE SCHOOL'S BUSINESS OFFICER IS INITIALLY DETERMINED BY ANALYZING COMPARABLE MARKET DATA PROVIDED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, THE NATIONAL BUSINESS OFFICERS ASSOCIATION, AND BY UTILIZING OTHER ONLINE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION SURVEYS. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS ULTIMATELY RESPONSIBLE FOR APPROVING THE BUSINESS OFFICER'S CONTRACTUAL COMPENSATION. THE BUSINESS OFFICER'S CONTRACTUAL COMPENSATION IS SET FOR A ONE YEAR PEIROD. AFTER THE INITIAL SALARY DETERMINATION, THE PERFORMANCE REVIEW OF THE BUSINESS OFFICER IS CONDUCTED ANNUALLY BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. FUTURE SALARY INCREASES FOR THE BUSINESS OFFICER ARE EVALUATED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND ARE BASED ON THE BUDGETING NEEDS OF THE SCHOOL. ANY SALARY INCREASE FOR THE BUSINESS OFFICER IS GENERALLY THE SAME PERCENTAGE INCREASE APPLIED ACROSS ALL EMPLOYEES AND IS SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE SCHOOL'S FINANCE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS CAN BE DISTRIBUTED UPON REQUEST. HOWEVER, ALL REQUESTS ARE SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND THE SCHOOL'S CONSIDERATION OF THE INTENDED USE OF THE REQUESTED DOCUMENTS.
CHANGE IN VALUATION OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST -11,707. ROUNDING
THE SCHOOL'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION AND RETENTION OF THE SCHOOL'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
